title: Hardee House
content:
Hardee House is a historic home located near Ormondsville, Greene County, North Carolina.  It was built between about 1842 and 1844, and is a two-story, single pile, three bay, Greek Revival style I-house dwelling.  It has an early-20th century Queen Anne style front porch with turned posts and decorative sawnwork brackets.  Also on the property is a contributing 2+1‚ÅÑ2-story gable-roof tobacco pack house.[2]

It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 2014.[1]

This article about a property in Granville County, North Carolina on the National Register of Historic Places is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
